location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Formal Recognition of Sayyid Turkī bin Sa‘īd Āl Bū Sa‘īd as Ruler of Muscat

mods.abstract: Letter and Enclosure to HM Secretary of State for India, dated 27 December 1871, concerning the formal recognition of Syud Toorkee [Sayyid Turkī bin Sa‘īd Āl Bū Sa‘īd] as Ruler of Muscat.The main correspondents are Lieutenant-Colonel Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; and Major Edward Charles Ross, Political Agent and Consul, Muscat.The papers record that the Political Agent, the officers of HMS Bullfinch, and 'all the English gentlemen at present in Muscat' were received by the new Sultan, and that a twenty-one gun salute was fired by the Bullfinch.The papers also contain a copy of a letter from Syud Toorkee.

name.namePart: Sultan of Muscat and Oman, Āl Bū Sa'īd Dynasty
